8. He is relieved when the woman tells him that the baby will not die, and he becomes emotional when he holds her close.
9. He continues to care for her even when he is aware that he is in trouble with the law, and that the detectives are looking for him.

Overall, Rags' actions demonstrate a sense of responsibility and care for the baby Margaret, and suggest that he is capable of putting her needs before his own.
